WorkItem.ClosedComment:
no problem, you can create a new issue or re-open this one any time.
*sebastian
WorkItem.Description:
Accidentally discovered this while processing some Word Documents that were undergoing massive revision. The Revisions.AcceptAll() method does not actually accept any of the changes in Word footnotes.
 
By contrast, _Document.AcceptAllRevisions() method accepts everything.
 
Sample documents and code are attached.

Comments.Message:
Forgot to mention: I'm using the NetOffice Api build 1.3.2.

Thanks,
Toby

are you sure this is a NetOffice issue?
in other words: working with interop assemblies works as well and NetOffice ignore the footnotes?
i do a test with the interop assemblies in vs2010 and word 2007 and i have exactly the same behavior.

It didn't occur to me that it might be a fundamental issue with the Microsoft API, but it looks as if you're right.

Thanks for checking into it.
